alert.note: Alert for Clay; Greene; Owen; Sullivan (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 08 at 11:30AM EDT by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Sullivan, southwestern Clay, southwestern Owen and northwestern Greene Counties through NOON EDT... At 1130 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 9 miles northeast of Sullivan to near Linton. Movement was northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. These storms will remain over mainly rural areas of northeastern Sullivan, southwestern Clay, southwestern Owen and northwestern Greene Counties, including the following locations... Hymera, Coal City, Coalmont, Cory, Saline City, Clay City and Jasonville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
